tn.text: See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:writing_poetry]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]]
"It happened." This phrase is used here to mark the beginning of a new part of the story. If your language has a way for doing this, you could consider using it here.

tn.ref: in the fourth year of Jehoiakim son of Josiah king of Judah
tn.text: See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:jer:25:01|25:1]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_ordinal]])
The phrase "this word" refers to the message that follows.
"all of the nations"
"I have told you from"

tn.ref: from the days of Josiah until this very day
tn.text: AT: "from the time of Josiah until today" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
"Maybe the people of Judah"

tn.ref: I intend to bring on them
tn.text: "I am planning to do to them"
"So that each person"
See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:jer:18:11|18:11]].

tn.ref: Baruch wrote in a scroll, at Jeremiah's dictation, all the words of Yahweh spoken to him
tn.text: "while Jeremiah was speaking, Baruch wrote in a scroll all of the words of Yahweh which Yahweh had spoken to Jeremiah"
"read out loud from the scroll" or "proclaim from the scroll"
"according to what I said"
"must read out loud" or "must proclaim"

tn.ref: in the hearing of the people in his house
tn.text: "so that the people in Yahweh's house can hear them"

tn.ref: in the hearing of all of Judah who have come from their cities
tn.text: "so all the people of Judah who have come from their cities can hear them"
Jeremiah continues to give instructions to Baruch.
"Maybe"
The word "their" refers to the people in the house of Yahweh and the people of Judah who had come to the house of Yahweh from their cities.

tn.ref: their pleas for mercy will come before Yahweh
tn.text: AT: "Yahweh will pay attention to their pleas for mercy." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: Perhaps each person will turn from his wicked way
tn.text: "Maybe they will repent; each person from his wicked way"
See how you translated "from his wicked path" in [[:en:bible:notes:jer:18:11|18:11]].
"the anger and rage"
See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:jer:36:01|36:1]].

tn.ref: in the fifth year and ninth month
tn.text: This is the ninth month of the Hebrew calendar. It is during the last part November and the first part December on Western calendars. AT: "in the ninth month of the fifth year." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_hebrewmonths]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_ordinal]])

tn.ref: of Jehoiakim son of Josiah, king of Judah
tn.text: See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:jer:25:01|25:1]].
"called for everyone to participate in a fast"
This is the name of a person. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
"who was a scribe"

tn.ref: by the gate of the entrance to the house of Yahweh
tn.text: "in the entrance of the new gate of the house of Yahweh"
He read aloud Jeremiah's words.
See how you translated "in the ears of Jerusalem" in [[:en:bible:notes:jer:02:01|2:2]].
This is the name of a person. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])

tn.ref: Micaiah son of Gemariah son of Shaphan
tn.text: "Micaiah who was the son of Gemariah, who was the son of Shaphan"
"to the room of the scribe"
The word "Look" here adds emphasis to what follows.
These are names of people. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
See how you translated this name in [[:en:bible:notes:jer:26:20|26:20]].
See how you translated this name in [[:en:bible:notes:jer:26:22|26:22]].
See how you translated this name in [[:en:bible:notes:jer:36:09|36:10]].
See how you translated this name in [[:en:bible:notes:jer:01:01|1:3]].
See how you translated this name in [[:en:bible:notes:jer:28:01|28:1]].
"and all of the other officials"
See how you translated this name in [[:en:bible:notes:jer:36:11|36:11]].
The word "them" refers to officials in [[:en:bible:notes:jer:36:11|36:12]].
"so that the people could hear"
These are the names of people. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
"read the scroll aloud"
This phrase is used here to mark an important event in the story. If your language has a way for doing this, you could consider using it here.
The word "they" refers to the officials.
the words that Baruch read aloud from the scroll

tn.ref: how did you come to write
tn.text: "how did you write"
See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:jer:36:04|36:4]].
Jeremiah spoke out loud so that Baruch could write down his words.
"used ink to write them"
a dark dye that is used for writing
AT: "and Jeremiah should hide himself too." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
The word "you" refers to Baruch and Jeremiah.
The word "they" refers to the officials.

tn.ref: deposited the scroll in the room of Elishama
tn.text: "put the scroll safely in the room of Elishama"
See how you translated "Elishama the scribe" in [[:en:bible:notes:jer:36:11|36:12]].
the words of the scroll which Jeremiah had dictated to Baruch
See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:jer:36:13|36:14]].

This is the ninth month of the Hebrew calendar. This is at the end of the sowing season and the beginning of the cold season. It is during the last part November and the first part December on Western calendars. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_hebrewmonths]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_ordinal]])

tn.ref: and a brazier was burning in front of him
tn.text: "and the brazier was in front of him with a blazing fire"
a fireplace that people can move
This phrase is used here to mark an important event in the story. If your language has a way for doing this, you could consider using it here.
See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:jer:36:13|36:14]].
these are columns of words on the scroll
"would cut that part off"
"using a scribe's knife" or "using the kind of knife that scribes use"
See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:jer:36:20|36:22]].

tn.ref: until all of the scroll was destroyed
tn.text: "until the scroll was completely gone"
the words from the scroll that Baruch wrote as Jeremiah dictated

tn.ref: nor did they tear their clothes
tn.text: People tore their cloths when they were extremely sad. AT: "nor did they mourn by tearing their clothes."
See how you translated these names in [[:en:bible:notes:jer:36:11|36:12]].
"pleaded with the king" or "entreated the king"
These are the names of men. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
"a relative of the king"

tn.ref: the word of Yahweh came to
tn.text: See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:jer:01:01|1:2]].
See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:jer:36:04|36:4]].

tn.ref: Go back, take another scroll for yourself
tn.text: "Take another scroll for yourself again"
"the first scroll"

tn.ref: Why have you written on it
tn.text: Jehoiakim uses this question to emphasize that Jeremiah should not have written that the king of Babylon would come and attack. AT: "You should not have written" or "You were wrong to write." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])
"and he will destroy"

tn.ref: will ever sit on the throne of David
tn.text: AT: "will ever rule as the heir of David." See how you translated "sits on the throne of David" in [[:en:bible:notes:jer:29:15|29:16]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: your corpse will be thrown out
tn.text: AT: "people will throw your dead body outside." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
"your dead body"
"so that it is exposed to the dry heat of the daytime"
"of all of you"
See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:jer:36:04|36:4]].

tn.ref: burned by Jehoiakim king of Judah
tn.text: "which Jehoiakim king of Judah had burned in the fire"

tn.ref: Furthermore, many other similar words were added to this scroll
tn.text: AT: "Furthermore, Jeremiah and Baruch added many more words which were similar to the words that had been in the first scroll." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
